alert.note: Alert for George; Greene; Perry; Stone (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 15 at 1:13PM CDT until April 15 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... George County in southeastern Mississippi... Perry County in southeastern Mississippi... Greene County in southeastern Mississippi... Stone County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 200 PM CDT. * At 112 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Sunrise to 4 miles south of Mclaurin to 6 miles northeast of Mcneil, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Wiggins, Lucedale, Richton, Leakesville, Perkinston, McHenry, Beaumont, New Augusta, McLain and State Line. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Damaging winds and hail and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
